CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 22, 1955, pg. 5, reads: "Cordice Tells Story - Reginald H. Cordice tells Courier reporter George Barbour that he fired a shotgun for the first time in his life to scare the persons who hurled pellets against this side picture window and another window in rear Saturday evening after he was disturbed an house earlier. Cordice said he aimed the gun into the air, but it "kicked."  It wasn't until after he reported the disturbance to the Justice of the Peace that he learned a young white boy had been hit with pellets.- All Photos by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Courier reporter George Barbour, interviewing Reginald H. Cordice about vandalism that occurred to his home, 3818 Foster Road, North Versailles
